newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar names first envoy to Bahrain in 26 years.
newsitem.headline: Qatar names first envoy to Bahrain in 26 years.

text.p: Qatar has named an ambassador to Bahrain after an agreement between the two Gulf Arab neighbours to open embassies to improve ties strained by their row over a cluster of potentially oil and gas-rich islands.
It was Qatar's first nomination of an ambassador to Bahrain since their independence from Britain in 1971.
"Saad Mohammad al-Romeihi's name has been sent to the Bahraini authorities for approval to head the first Qatari diplomatic mission in Manama", a Qatari official told Reuters.
The nomination of Romeihi, director of Qatar's state-run television, was delivered to the foreign ministry through Bahrain's embassy in Saudi Arabia a few days ago, he said.
Both countries agreed last month to open embassies in a bid to improve ties strained over a row over the Gulf islands.
Their relations worsened last year after Bahrain arrested, tried and released two Qataris on spy charges.
Qatar has also accused Bahrain of masterminding a failed coup attempt in Doha last year.
Doha has taken the islands row to the International Court of Justice at The Hague, a move that angered Manama which prefers a regional solution through Gulf Arab or Saudi mediation.

Bahrain boycotted a Gulf Cooperation Council summit in Doha last December but urged its other partners in the six-nation alliance, which includes Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, the United Arab Emirates and Oman, to try and improve bilateral tensions.
